Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (18 ll. and 3 ll. effaced), verso blank. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Petition of Tef-Hap son of Petetumis to the lord Spemminis prophet of Thoth and royal overseer (sHn) regarding wrongs done him by his half-brother Twot. Date year 11 Phamenoth 21 [of Ptolemy Philometor] = BC 170 April 24". Nos. 10575-10601 from the Siut Archive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43409) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43409)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured Black ink (smudged) Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
Acquisition notes: Purchased from M. Nahman. Cf. the additional sheets at the end of Thompson's MS Catalogue, titled "B.M. Nahman Papyri (1923)".
